intro: Thymus striatus subsp. ophioliticus, commonly known as the ophiolitic thyme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its dense, low-growing habit and aromatic leaves that are often used in culinary and medicinal applications. The plant typically thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils, preferring full sun exposure. Its small pink or white flowers bloom in the spring, adding ornamental value to its habitat. Botanically, it belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is known for its aromatic properties and medicinal uses.
